1.text: These were the sons of Israel: Reuben, Simeon, Levi, Judah, Issachar, Zebulun,

2.text: Dan, Joseph, Benjamin, Naphtali, Gad, and Asher.

3.text: The sons of Judah: Er, Onan, and Shelah. These three were born to him by Bath-shua the Canaanite. Er, Judah’s firstborn, was wicked in the sight of the LORD. So the LORD put him to death.

4.text: Tamar, Judah’s daughter-in-law, bore to him Perez and Zerah. Judah had five sons in all.

5.text: The sons of Perez: Hezron and Hamul.

6.text: The sons of Zerah: Zimri, Ethan, Heman, Calcol, and Dara—five in all.

7.text: The son of Carmi: Achar, who brought trouble upon Israel by violating the ban on devoted things.

9.text: The sons who were born to Hezron: Jerahmeel, Ram, and Caleb.

10.text: Ram was the father of Amminadab, and Amminadab was the father of Nahshon, a leader of the descendants of Judah.

11.text: Nahshon was the father of Salmon, and Salmon was the father of Boaz.

12.text: Boaz was the father of Obed, and Obed was the father of Jesse.

13.text: Jesse was the father of Eliab his firstborn; Abinadab was born second, Shimea third,

16.text: Their sisters were Zeruiah and Abigail. And the three sons of Zeruiah were Abishai, Joab, and Asahel.

17.text: Abigail was the mother of Amasa, whose father was Jether the Ishmaelite.

18.text: Caleb son of Hezron had children by his wife Azubah and by Jerioth. These were the sons of Azubah: Jesher, Shobab, and Ardon.

19.text: When Azubah died, Caleb married Ephrath, who bore to him Hur.

20.text: Hur was the father of Uri, and Uri was the father of Bezalel.

21.text: Later, Hezron slept with the daughter of Machir the father of Gilead. He had married her when he was sixty years old, and she bore to him Segub.

22.text: Segub was the father of Jair, who had twenty-three cities in the land of Gilead.

23.text: But Geshur and Aram captured Havvoth-jair, along with Kenath and its sixty surrounding villages. All these were descendants of Machir the father of Gilead.

24.text: After Hezron died in Caleb-ephrathah, his wife Abijah bore to him Ashhur the father of Tekoa.

25.text: The sons of Jerahmeel the firstborn of Hezron: Ram his firstborn, Bunah, Oren, Ozem, and Ahijah.

26.text: Jerahmeel had another wife named Atarah, who was the mother of Onam.

27.text: The sons of Ram the firstborn of Jerahmeel: Maaz, Jamin, and Eker.

28.text: The sons of Onam: Shammai and Jada. The sons of Shammai: Nadab and Abishur.

29.text: Abishur’s wife was named Abihail, and she bore to him Ahban and Molid.

30.text: The sons of Nadab: Seled and Appaim. Seled died without children.

31.text: The son of Appaim: Ishi. The son of Ishi: Sheshan. The son of Sheshan: Ahlai.

32.text: The sons of Jada the brother of Shammai: Jether and Jonathan. Jether died without children.

33.text: The sons of Jonathan: Peleth and Zaza. These were the descendants of Jerahmeel.

34.text: Sheshan had no sons, but only daughters. He also had an Egyptian servant named Jarha.

35.text: Sheshan gave his daughter in marriage to his servant Jarha, and she bore to him Attai.

36.text: Attai was the father of Nathan, Nathan was the father of Zabad,

37.text: Zabad was the father of Ephlal, Ephlal was the father of Obed,

38.text: Obed was the father of Jehu, Jehu was the father of Azariah,

39.text: Azariah was the father of Helez, Helez was the father of Elasah,

40.text: Elasah was the father of Sismai, Sismai was the father of Shallum,

41.text: Shallum was the father of Jekamiah, and Jekamiah was the father of Elishama.

42.text: The sons of Caleb the brother of Jerahmeel: Mesha his firstborn, who was the father of Ziph, and Mareshah his second son, who was the father of Hebron.

43.text: The sons of Hebron: Korah, Tappuah, Rekem, and Shema.

44.text: Shema was the father of Raham the father of Jorkeam, and Rekem was the father of Shammai.

45.text: The son of Shammai was Maon, and Maon was the father of Beth-zur.

46.text: Caleb’s concubine Ephah was the mother of Haran, Moza, and Gazez. Haran was the father of Gazez.

47.text: The sons of Jahdai: Regem, Jotham, Geshan, Pelet, Ephah, and Shaaph.

48.text: Caleb’s concubine Maacah was the mother of Sheber and Tirhanah.

49.text: She was also the mother of Shaaph father of Madmannah, and of Sheva father of Machbenah and Gibea. Caleb’s daughter was Acsah.

50.text: These were the descendants of Caleb. The sons of Hur the firstborn of Ephrathah: Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim,

51.text: Salma the father of Bethlehem, and Hareph the father of Beth-gader.

52.text: These were the descendants of Shobal the father of Kiriath-jearim: Haroeh, half the Manahathites,

53.text: and the clans of Kiriath-jearim—the Ithrites, Puthites, Shumathites, and Mishraites. From these descended the Zorathites and Eshtaolites.

54.text: The descendants of Salma: Bethlehem, the Netophathites, Atroth-beth-joab, half the Manahathites, the Zorites,

55.text: and the clans of the scribes who lived at Jabez—the Tirathites, Shimeathites, and Sucathites. These are the Kenites who came from Hammath, the father of the house of Rechab.
